title: Agriculture
description: Ozonation in agriculture increases yields, extends product shelf life and ensures biosecurity. An eco-friendly alternative to chemical pesticides and preservatives.

poultry.title: Poultry farming
poultry.shortDesc: Disinfection of eggs, incubators and poultry house premises
poultry.content:
Ozonation is a key technology for modern poultry farms. Ozone use covers all production stages: from egg incubation to storage of finished product.

Ozone effectively disinfects hatching eggs with 92–98% efficiency, destroying Salmonella, E. coli and other pathogens without damaging the shell. This increases hatchability by 0.8–2.0% and reduces early mortality.

Poultry house ozonation destroys up to 99.9% of bacteria, viruses and fungi in the air and on surfaces. Regular air ozonation reduces flock morbidity and improves weight gain and feed conversion.

Ozonated drinking water contains more oxygen and has no pathogenic microflora, which positively affects flock health and productivity.

intro.paragraph1: Ozonation is a key technology for modern industrial poultry farming. Thanks to ozone's unique antibacterial properties, environmental purity, safety and ease of use, the technology finds application at all production stages: from egg incubation to storage of finished product.
intro.paragraph2: Poor microclimate and bacterial contamination in facilities reduce laying hen egg production by 25% and average daily gain by 10%. Ozonation solves these problems without using chemical agents that can enter food products.
intro.warningText: Maximum permissible ozone concentration for poultry is up to 1.2 mg/m³ — 12 times higher than for humans (0.1 mg/m³). This allows effective treatment in the presence of birds when regimes are followed.

Feed disinfection — reduced microflora and toxins

incubation.title: Egg incubation: increased hatchability
incubation.intro: Treatment of hatching eggs with ozone (~10 mg/m³) improves their quality and increases hatchability with subsequent high viability. In the confined space of an incubator, there is a risk of oxygen starvation of embryos. Ozone, as a derivative of oxygen, improves the air environment and, penetrating through the shell, nourishes embryos with oxygen.

incubation.highlight: VNITIP recommendations: long-term storage of hatching eggs in an ozone environment prevents premature spoilage, reduces shell contamination by 2–7 times, prevents mold development and extends storage life to 10 days.

airDisinfection.title: Air disinfection on poultry farms
airDisinfection.intro1: As a result of bird activity, poultry house air becomes contaminated with harmful substances: ammonia (up to 0.3–0.5 mg/l at MPC 0.01 mg/l), hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, organic dust with microflora (up to 30–50 mg/l).
airDisinfection.intro2: Ozonation in a recirculation system allows air cleaning without significant ventilation and heating costs.
airDisinfection.tableCaption: Poultry house air cleaning efficiency (ozone concentration 11.3 mg/l)
airDisinfection.highlight: Periodic ozonation (8–12 hours once every 3–5 days) reduces harmful gas content by 80–85% and bacterial and mold contamination by 80–90%.

feedDisinfection.title: Feed disinfection
feedDisinfection.intro: Microflora and mold fungi in feed produce toxins that pose a threat to bird health. Ozone treatment of feed significantly reduces microflora and toxins, increases biological value and feed digestibility.

storage.title: Extended poultry meat storage
storage.intro: Positive effect in meat storage is achieved with daily ozonation for 2 hours at ozone concentration ~6 mg/m³. Poultry meat preservation in chilled form (+4°C) increases 4 times.
storage.highlight: After 20 days of storage, meat with ozonation maintained initial freshness and tenderness without odor. Without treatment — greenish color and putrid odor after just 5 days.

items.title: Economy

livestock.title: Livestock farming
livestock.shortDesc: Farm disinfection, feed treatment and extended meat storage
livestock.content:
In livestock farming, ozonation addresses a range of tasks: from maintaining sanitary conditions to extending meat product shelf life.

Air ozonation in livestock buildings reduces concentrations of pathogens, ammonia and unpleasant odors. This improves microclimate, reduces animal stress and respiratory disease risk.

For meat storage, ozonation ensures destruction of surface microflora on carcasses while preserving nutritional and sensory quality. Regular cold room ozonation can extend chilled meat shelf life 2–5 times.

Ozone concentration of 10 mg/m³ for 2–5 hours ensures complete destruction of mesophilic and psychrotrophic microflora on meat surface at 1–4°C.

productivityGrowth.label: Productivity growth
productivityGrowth.description: Average daily gain and milk yield

intro.paragraph1: Modern livestock farming faces serious challenges: growing antibiotic resistance, stricter requirements for product eco-friendliness, and the need to increase productivity while reducing costs. Ozonation is a technology that addresses these challenges comprehensively.
intro.paragraph2: Ozone application in livestock farming can reduce morbidity by 30-50%, increase productivity by 10-15%, and eliminate preventive antibiotic use. This is especially relevant in the context of the EU ban on using antibiotics as growth promoters.

pdkInfo.label: MPC of ozone for animals:
pdkInfo.text: up to 1.0 mg/m³ for cattle and pigs, up to 1.2 mg/m³ for poultry. This allows preventive treatments in the presence of animals when regimes are followed.

airDisinfection.title: Air disinfection in buildings
airDisinfection.intro: Air in livestock buildings is contaminated with ammonia, hydrogen sulfide, dust and microorganisms. Ammonia concentration can reach 0.02-0.03 mg/l at MPC of 0.01 mg/l. This reduces productivity, increases morbidity and worsens working conditions for staff.
airDisinfection.tableCaption: Effectiveness of air ozonation in dairy barn
airDisinfection.highlight: Regular ozonation (2-3 times daily for 15-20 minutes at 0.5-1.0 mg/m³ concentration) reduces cattle respiratory diseases by 40-50% and increases average daily gain by 8-12%.

waterDisinfection.intro: Water quality directly affects animal health and productivity. Water from open sources and even artesian wells often contains pathogenic microorganisms, iron, manganese and organic compounds.
items: Destruction of E.coli, Salmonella, Campylobacter and other pathogens
Oxidation of iron and manganese to insoluble forms
Elimination of unpleasant odors and tastes
Improved water digestibility by animals
Prevention of gastrointestinal diseases

feedTreatment.title: Feed treatment

feedTreatment.highlight: Recommended feed treatment regime: ozone concentration 10-15 mg/m³, treatment time 60-120 minutes depending on feed moisture and contamination.

dairyEquipment.title: Dairy equipment disinfection
dairyEquipment.intro: On dairy farms, ozone is used to disinfect milking equipment, cooling tanks, milk pipelines and containers. This allows avoiding chemical cleaning agents and ensuring dairy product safety.

vegetable-storage.title: Vegetable storage
vegetable-storage.shortDesc: Reduced losses of vegetables and fruit during long storage
vegetable-storage.content:
Vegetable storage ozonation is an effective way to reduce losses during long-term storage. Ozone quickly and thoroughly disinfects air and surfaces, destroying viruses, bacteria, fungi and mold.

Ozone breaks down ethylene, which accelerates ripening and shortens storage life. This allows storing ethylene-sensitive produce together with ethylene-producing produce.

For a 300-ton carrot store, ozonation equipment can reduce losses on average by a factor of 3.

Treatment regime for most vegetables and fruit: 1–2 times per day for 2–4 hours. Special regimes are used for potatoes, cabbage, apples and other crops.

intro.paragraph1: Storage losses of vegetables and fruit range from 20 to 40% of total volume. Main causes are mold development, bacterial rot, premature sprouting and wilting. Ozonation solves these problems comprehensively, extending storage life by 1.5–2 times without chemical agents.
intro.paragraph2: Unlike fungicides and preservatives, ozone does not accumulate in products, decomposing to oxygen. This is especially important for organic farming and production of eco-friendly food.

principle.title: Principle of action:
principle.text: Ozone destroys mold, yeast and bacteria on vegetable surfaces and in storage air. It also breaks down ethylene — a gas that accelerates ripening and aging of fruits.

diseases.title: Storage disease control
diseases.intro: Main storage diseases of vegetables are caused by fungi and bacteria. Ozone is effective against all major pathogens:
items: Potato late blight — 60–80% reduction in infection
Gray mold (Botrytis) — 95% spore destruction
Wet rot — suppression of bacterial development
Fusarium — 70% reduction in infection
Fruit penicillium — 90% spore destruction
Carrot blackleg — prevention of development
diseases.highlight: With regular ozonation (2–3 mg/m³, 4–6 hours daily), potato late blight infection decreases from 15–20% to 3–5%, saving up to 30% of the crop.

modes.title: Vegetable storage ozonation modes
modes.note: It is important to consider that ozonation mode depends on temperature, humidity and product condition. At high humidity (over 95%), ozone effectiveness increases.

items.title: Odor elimination
items.description: Ozone neutralizes odors of decay, mustiness, chemicals in storage

items.title: Sprouting suppression
items.description: Slowing sprouting of potatoes and onions without chemical inhibitors

items.title: Ethylene breakdown
items.description: Ethylene oxidation slows ripening and aging of fruits

items.title: Disinsection
items.description: Destruction of pest insects and their larvae in storage

economic.title: Economic effect
economic.intro: Implementation of ozonation in vegetable storage provides significant economic benefits:
economic.highlight: Equipment payback for ozonation of a 1000-ton vegetable storage is 1–2 storage seasons through loss reduction and higher sales prices.

greenhouses.title: Greenhouses and crop production
greenhouses.shortDesc: Higher yields and plant disease protection
greenhouses.heroText: 13–35% yield increase, protection from diseases and pests without chemical pesticides. Eco-friendly technology for modern greenhouse operations.
greenhouses.content:
In greenhouse production, ozone is used to disinfect air, plant surfaces and soil. Ozonation increases yields and effectively controls disease without chemical pesticides.

Ozone dissolves in water about 15 times better than oxygen. Irrigation with ozonated water increases yields by 13–35% through improved soil quality, greater root mass and reduced root pathogens.

Disinfection of greenhouse soils with concentrated ozone solution effectively suppresses root-knot nematode by 90–98% and stimulates plant growth. Biomass can increase by up to 30%.

Greenhouse air ozonation destroys fungi, bacteria, yeast, viruses and pests. High concentrations are used to prepare the greenhouse for planting when the facility is unoccupied.
benefits: 30–45% more dissolved oxygen in irrigation water

irrigation.title: Ozonated water irrigation
irrigation.intro: Irrigation with ozone-enriched water is one of the most effective technologies for increasing yields. Ozone quickly decomposes to oxygen, saturating the root zone and stimulating plant development.
irrigation.tableCaption: Effect of ozonated water on yield of various crops
irrigation.highlight: Research shows that regular irrigation with ozonated water increases plant root mass by 15–25%, ensuring better nutrient uptake and stress resistance.

soilDisinfection.title: Greenhouse soil disinfection
soilDisinfection.intro: Root-knot nematode is one of the main enemies of greenhouse crops. Chemical control methods are ineffective and contaminate the soil. Soil ozonation with concentrated ozone solution effectively suppresses nematodes and stimulates plant development.
soilDisinfection.tableCaption: Effectiveness of ozonation against soil pathogens

aquaculture.title: Aquaculture (RAS)
aquaculture.shortDesc: Water treatment and fish disease control in recirculating aquaculture systems
aquaculture.content:
In fish farming, ozonation is used at all production stages: from water preparation to storage of harvest. Ozone disinfects water, controls fish diseases and extends storage life.

In recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS), ozonation removes heavy metal ions, microalgae, toxins, fungal spores, microbes and cysts. Water turbidity drops significantly and unpleasant odors disappear.

Ozone destroys up to 99% of pathogenic organisms: viruses, bacteria and parasitic protozoa. This reduces fish morbidity and mortality and allows higher stocking density.

Recommended ozone dose is about 13 g per 1 kg of feed. In clean water, fish gain weight faster and the production cycle shortens.

intro.paragraph1: In fish farming, ozonation is used at all production stages: from water preparation to storage of finished product. Ozone disinfects water, controls fish diseases and significantly shortens the production cycle.
intro.paragraph2: In recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS), ozonation removes heavy metal ions, microalgae, toxins, fungal spores, microbes and cysts from water. Water turbidity is significantly reduced, unpleasant odors disappear, and optimal conditions for fish growth are created.

dosage.title: Recommended dosage:
dosage.text: 13 g of ozone per 1 kg of feed. This dosage achieves an optimal balance between disinfection effectiveness and fish safety.

grain-storage.title: Grain storage
grain-storage.shortDesc: Protection from pests and microorganisms without chemicals
grain-storage.heroText: Protection from pests and microorganisms without chemicals. 95–99% insect destruction, 40–60% storage loss reduction.
grain-storage.content:
Grain storage is a critical process where pest losses can account for 5 to 50% of world production. Seed and grain ozonation effectively controls pests and prevents mold spread.

Ozone affects insects and mites at all life stages. After treatment at 30–60 mg/m³ for 30–60 minutes, mortality of grain weevil, rice weevil and grain borer reaches 95–99%.

Grain disinfection level at exposure from 15 minutes to 1 hour reaches 80–95% for total contamination and 80–90% for mold fungi. Treatment does not impair sensory or nutritional quality.

Pre-sowing seed ozonation increases germination and stress resistance. Wheat yield can increase by about 22%, barley by about 17.5%.

applications.title: Ozone application areas
items: Grain disinsection — elimination of storage pests
Disinfection — reduction of microbial and fungal contamination

pests.title: Storage pest elimination
pests.intro: Ozone affects insects and mites at all life stages: eggs, larvae, pupae and adults. The mechanism is based on oxidation of cuticle lipids and destruction of insect respiratory systems.
pests.highlightText: Unlike chemical fumigation, ozonation leaves no residues in grain. After treatment, ozone quickly decomposes to oxygen, and the product is completely safe for consumption.

fungi.title: Disinfection and mycotoxin reduction
fungi.intro: Mold fungi on grain produce dangerous mycotoxins: aflatoxins, zearalenone, deoxynivalenol (DON). Ozonation destroys fungi and partially breaks down already formed toxins.
fungi.tableCaption: Ozonation effectiveness against fungi and mycotoxins

modes.title: Grain ozonation modes
modes.intro: Mode selection depends on treatment goals: prevention, disinsection or disinfection. It is important to consider grain moisture, temperature and storage airtightness.
modes.warningText: When treating grain with moisture above 14%, ozonation effectiveness decreases. Pre-drying or increasing ozone dose by 20–30% is recommended.

presowing.title: Pre-sowing seed treatment
presowing.intro: Ozone seed treatment increases germination, germination energy and seedling resistance to adverse conditions. Research confirms significant yield gains.

worldExperience.label: World experience
worldExperience.text: Grain ozonation is used in the USA, Canada, Australia and EU countries as an eco-friendly alternative to phosphine and methyl bromide, banned by the Montreal Protocol.

steps.title: Storage preparation
steps.description: Cleaning of grain residues and dust. Checking airtightness of gates, hatches and seams.

steps.title: Equipment installation
steps.description: Placing ozonator and ozone distribution system. Connection to power supply.

steps.title: Sealing
steps.description: Closing all openings, installing warning signs about treatment.

steps.title: Ozone supply
steps.description: Starting ozonator, monitoring concentration with sensors. Treatment time 2–6 hours.

steps.title: Holding
steps.description: After reaching target concentration, holding for 30–60 minutes without ozone supply.

steps.title: Degassing
steps.description: Turning on ventilation to remove residual ozone. Monitoring MPC (0.1 mg/m³).

beekeeping.title: Beekeeping
beekeeping.shortDesc: Hive and comb disinfection and bee disease control
beekeeping.heroText: Hive and comb disinfection, bee disease control. Increase in honey yield by 25 kg per season and 39% increase in colony productivity.
beekeeping.content:
Ozonation in beekeeping is used to disinfect hives, frames and combs from bee disease pathogens. Treatment with moderate ozone concentrations has a beneficial effect on colony activity.

Regular ozonation reduces pathogenic microorganisms and humidity in the hive air and improves gas composition. As a result, treated colonies can show about 25 kg more marketable honey per season.

For chalkbrood (ascosphaerosis) control, ozone at 250 mg/m³ for 1 hour twice daily for 7 days is used. In severe cases, 500 mg/m³ four times daily.

Ozone effectively acts on spores of the fungus Ascosphaera apis. Disinfection level reaches 50–77% depending on the treated surface material.
benefits: About 25 kg more honey per season

paragraphs.intro1: Ozonation in beekeeping is used to disinfect hives, frames and combs from bee disease pathogens. Treatment with moderate ozone concentrations has a beneficial effect on colony activity.
paragraphs.intro2: Regular ozonation reduces pathogenic microorganisms, decreases humidity in the hive air and improves gas composition. As a result, treated colonies showed an increase in marketable honey production of 25 kg per season compared to the control group.
paragraphs.ascospherosis: Chalkbrood (ascosphaerosis) is one of the most common fungal diseases of bees, caused by Ascosphaera apis. Fungal spores are resistant to traditional disinfection methods but are destroyed by ozone.
paragraphs.pathogens: Ozone is effective against a wide range of bee disease pathogens — bacteria, fungi and viruses. This allows using a single technology for comprehensive apiary protection.
paragraphs.stimulation: Treatment of hives with moderate ozone concentrations (5-15 mg/m³) in the presence of bees has a stimulating effect: increases colony activity, improves queen egg-laying and accelerates spring development.
paragraphs.equipment: Combs and beekeeping equipment can be a source of infection for healthy colonies. Regular ozone disinfection prevents disease spread in the apiary.

research.label: Scientific research:
research.text: Experiments conducted at the Beekeeping Research Institute confirmed a 39% increase in colony productivity with regular hive ozonation during the spring-summer period.

highlightBoxes.ascospherosis: Ozone effectively acts on spores of the fungus Ascosphaera apis. Disinfection level reaches 50-77% depending on the treated surface material and ozone concentration.

warning.label: Important:
warning.text: Treatment with high ozone concentrations (over 200 mg/m³) should be performed in the absence of bees. For stimulating bee treatment, concentration should not exceed 10-15 mg/m³.

processSteps.title: Hive preparation
processSteps.description: Removal of bees or planning treatment in the absence of the colony. Closing entrances.

processSteps.title: Ozonator connection
processSteps.description: Installing ozone supply hose through the upper entrance or special opening in the lid.

processSteps.title: Ozone treatment
processSteps.description: Ozone supply at specified concentration for 30-90 minutes depending on the goal.

processSteps.title: Exposure
processSteps.description: After stopping ozone supply, exposure for 15-30 minutes with closed entrances.

processSteps.title: Ventilation
processSteps.description: Opening entrances for residual ozone exit. Time — 15-30 minutes.

processSteps.title: Bee return
processSteps.description: Settling the treated hive with a bee colony 1-2 hours after treatment.
